name: Erdős #340: Greedy Sidon Sequence Growth
description: Let A = {1,2,4,8,13,21,31,45,66,...} be the greedy Sidon sequence. Conjecture: |A ∩ {1,...,N}| >> N^(1/2-ε) for all ε > 0. Best known bound is Ω(N^(1/3)).

insights: Sidon sets (B₂ sequences) are sets where all pairwise sums are distinct
Greedy Sidon sequence: OEIS A005282, also called Mian-Chowla sequence
Axiomatization approach needed since computational construction is complex
DeepMind has formalized Sidon sets but not in Mathlib
Mathlib has asymptotics infrastructure (IsBigO, atTop filters)
Key insight: Sidon property implies distinct pairwise differences (proved via IsSidon.diff_injective)
omega/linarith struggle with Nat subtraction - need explicit Nat.sub_add_cancel in proofs
Don't submit open conjectures to Aristotle - it will spin indefinitely at low progress
